profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Lynn Marshall Case (1903-1996) was a University of Pennsylvania Professor of History, specializing in European diplomatic history and the history of the Second Empire. She received her master's degree (1929) and Ph.D. (1931) from the University of Pennsylvania. Her books included French Opinion on War and Diplomacy During the Second Empire (1954) and The United States and France: Civil War Diplomacy (1970).

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of notes from research on diplomatic history compiled by Lynn Marshall Case. Subjects include 19th century European diplomatic history (12 boxes), French opinion (3 boxes), and France and the American Civil War (2 boxes). There are notes from printed and manuscript sources in European and American research libraries, including extracts from letters, government documents, and published histories and memoirs, in English, French, Italian.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Pennsylvania, Archives and Records Center: Lynn Marshall Case papers (UPT 50 C337).
